docs.title: Welcome to AnkiDojo
docs.text: AnkiDojo is an easy-to-use and fully-featured Japanese toolkit for Anki.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Import cards from Kindle, handwritten notes, or txt file.
  • Adds pitch accent, definition, and audio.
  • Mini games with your Japanese cards. Difficulty based on the ease level in your Anki deck.

docs.title: Open source and simple API
docs.text:
• Simple and straightforward API to leverage Anki Dojo's mapping.
  • Feel free to submit your own apps for Anki Dojo!

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
You can find AnkiDojo on Anki web.

In Anki, select Tools > Add-ons > Get Add-ons, and paste the code: 433778282

You will also need to install Mecab Unidic Addon to unlock all of AnkiDojo's functionality. Double click on the addon file with Anki active, and restart Anki once installation is complete.

docs.title: Launching AnkiDojo
docs.text:
After installation, restart Anki and launch AnkiDojo from Tools > AnkiDojo.

Shortcut ctrl+I or command+I can be used as well.

Information

Shortcut ctrl+I or command+I can be used as well. If nothing happens, Anki may not have permission to open links. In that case, visit http://localhost:5008/apps

docs.title: Configuring Anki
docs.text:
Navigate to Settings and select Add Card Format.

Select a model.

For each field, select the corresponding value. If nothing matches, you can keep it empty.

Click Add Format to confirm your card type.

Finally, to make adding cards more convenient, select a primary deck.

Now you're good to go to use AnkiDojo. You can know about more settings by using the search bar here.
